result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick R Watkins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick R Watkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court for Derrick R Watkins.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. Final pretrial held. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 37 on 101/10/2020 at 9:00 a.m.  Defendant has filed a prompt disposition.  Attorney Anderson informed the court that defendant is waiving his prompt disposition request.  Court held colloquy with defendant who confirms he is freely and voluntarily waiving his right to a prompt disposition.  Defendant also agrees to remove the 10/10/2020 jury trial date to allow time for his case to resolve in the felony Reserve Branch.  Defendant's appearance is waived for the next court date in Branch 37.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Derrick R. Watkins - #481289, Green Bay Correctional Institution, PO Box 19033, Green Bay WI 54307).
Letter from defendant re:  representing ProSe and requesting Discovery.  (Derrick R. Watkins - #481289, Green Bay Correctional Institution, PO Box 19033, Green Bay WI 54307).

Defendant Derrick R Watkins not in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court for Derrick R Watkins.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Prompt disposition request filed, case is being set for jury trial. Case is adjourned in Branch 37.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derrick R Watkins not in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Attorney Scott Anderson contacted the Court stating that he is in trial with the defendant and is requesting to have this scheduling conference rescheduled. Parties notified.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick R Watkins in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Derrick R Watkins in custody at Green Bay Correctional.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick R Watkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MCSO Officer G. Kohl. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02, Judge Childs.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court in person, defendant Derrick R Watkins not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, appear by video. Defendant Derrick R Watkins not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant unavailable due to being in transit from MCSO to Greenbay Co. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Derrick R Watkins in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Derrick R Watkins in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick R Watkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
